## Description {#details}

Drive the analysis of memory accesses in the loop.

This class is responsible for analyzing the memory accesses of a loop. It collects the accesses and then its main helper the AccessAnalysis class finds and categorizes the dependences in buildDependenceSets.

For memory dependences that can be analyzed at compile time, it determines whether the dependence is part of cycle inhibiting vectorization. This work is delegated to the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memorydepchecker">MemoryDepChecker</a> class.

For memory dependences that cannot be determined at compile time, it generates run-time checks to prove independence. This is done by <a href="/docs/api/classes/anonymous-namespace-loopaccessanalysis-cpp-/accessanalysis/#a60735e0d022845d03d123916bb48e1e8">AccessAnalysis::canCheckPtrAtRT</a> and the checks are maintained by the <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a12b6596f3de8ec2382209b04c2b5444c">RuntimePointerCheck</a> class.

If pointers can wrap or can&#39;t be expressed as affine AddRec expressions by <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scalarevolution">ScalarEvolution</a>, we will generate run-time checks by emitting a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scevunionpredicate">SCEVUnionPredicate</a>.

Checks for both memory dependences and the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> predicates contained in the PSE must be emitted in order for the results of this analysis to be valid.

Definition at line 636 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopaccessanalysis-h">LoopAccessAnalysis.h</a>.

## Public Member Functions

### canVectorizeMemory() {#a3e05d925e750d2cffbf3c385f3a5028c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="bool llvm::LoopAccessInfo::canVectorizeMemory () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Return true we can analyze the memory accesses in the loop and there are no memory dependence cycles.

Note that for dependences between loads &amp; stores with uniform addresses, hasStoreStoreDependenceInvolvingLoopInvariantAddress and hasLoadStoreDependenceInvolvingLoopInvariantAddress also need to be checked.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopaccessanalysis-h/#l00648">648</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopaccessanalysis-h">LoopAccessAnalysis.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getPSE() {#a9a61799e7c5c7eef0a748045338e791f}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>const PredicatedScalarEvolution &amp; llvm::LoopAccessInfo::getPSE () const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Used to add runtime <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> checks.

Simplifies <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> expressions and converts them to a more usable form. All <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/scev">SCEV</a> expressions during the analysis should be re-written (and therefore simplified) according to PSE. A user of <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/loopaccessanalysis">LoopAccessAnalysis</a> will need to emit the runtime checks associated with this predicate.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopaccessanalysis-h/#l00722">722</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/analysis/loopaccessanalysis-h">LoopAccessAnalysis.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### getStoresToInvariantAddresses() {#a055f645011d7adec159e5f73bcbe68bd}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ArrayRef&lt; StoreInst &#42; &gt; llvm::LoopAccessInfo::getStoresToInvariantAddresses () const</>}
